ygData.subject: Re: OOC: People posting before others can fairly reply
ygData.msgSnippet: Then it would be better if everyone gets to throw their two cents in. Let s continue this on NBW online, since that s what it s made for.

Then it would be better if everyone gets to throw their two cents in.
Let's continue this on NBW online, since that's what it's made for.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Polar Claw <cycodrone@y...> wrote:
> Except that you haven't covered people posting before
> people can fairly reply. I mean at the end of the day
> we're in an RPG that essentially is international. As
> such there are often MASSIVE time zone differences
> between some players. I mean I've been trying to be
> diplomatic about the issue, but to be blunt, this
> situation is really starting to PISS ME OFF!!!!! I'm
> at the moment in the middle of a scene where I can't
> fairly reply (the attn: maximals one) because people
> are posting 40 replies when I'm either at work or
> asleep.  Airly, you say that the council should
> discuss this issue, well tell me, excatly WHEN you
> plan on doing this. The fact is that this is exactly
> in the vein of the split second posting and not
> posting for other characters rule. It effectively
> stops players from being able to play properly, and I
> for one am getting SICK OF IT!!!!! So how about we
> bypass the discussion and use a little something
> called common sense and just be aware of any players
> who aren't getting a fair chance to respond.
> 
> *gets off soapbox*
> 
>  --- Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote: 
> ---------------------------------
> I really think we should go with this way in the title
> of our posts. 
> It would make it all easier for everyone, and those
> who wanted to do 
> only the posts where their chars are concerned could
> do it much more 
> easily. That was my moderator speech, now let's all go
> on with our 
> lives.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a...
> wrote:
> > ::Puts hands together, slight bow a la Jack
> Sparrow::: 
> > 
> > Much appreciated. I'm in 50 lists, over half of
> those are RPGs... 
> so... makes 
> > it difficult for me to... check 100+ emails a day
> when I don't 
> have much time 
> > as it is. I prefer to have a life than just online.
> Thank you. :) 
> > 
> > My other issue... I've mentioned this to Airly...
> about in the 
> subject 
> > heading.. putting the title of the "scene" then in
> (( ))  put the 
> character that is 
> > posting followed by an ATTN then the characters that
> are to read & 
> respond to 
> > a certain post.
> > I've learned this from a couple other RPGs in which
> has made 
> RPGing MUCH 
> > easier... defered from wrong posting, blitz posted,
> etc. Keeping 
> the story at a 
> > steady enough pace & a VERY good storyline too. 
> > Maybe we can adopt this? Would be SOOOO much easier
> especially on 
> someone who 
> > doesn't particularly want to read TONS of email that
> does not 
> pertain to them 
> > since reading something I really don't need to know
> can confuse. 
> > 
> > 
> > Much appreciated, :: again bows a la Jack Sparrow:: 
> > Stac
> > ~Maxima
>
